meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel more confident or courageous.
meanings.sent1: Seeing his friends cheering him on emboldens him to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The supportive words from his family emboldens him to face his fears.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion emboldens the timid mouse to challenge the cat.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun emboldens the flowers to open up and greet the day.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging smile from his teacher emboldens him to speak up in class.

meanings.definition: To give (someone) the courage or confidence to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk emboldens the team to give their best on the field.
meanings.sent2: The success of her first project emboldens her to take on bigger challenges.
meanings.sent3: The lucky charm emboldens the player to take a risky shot.
meanings.sent4: The sound of applause emboldens the actor to deliver a powerful monologue.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful scenery emboldens the hiker to climb higher and explore more.
